intro: [WRONG START] Carex flavocuspis subsp. krascheninninnikovii, commonly known as the Krascheninnikov's sedge, is a perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, cylindrical leaves and produces small, clustered spikes of pale yellow to brown flowers. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tundra and rocky habitats. It plays a vital role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments and is adapted to cold climates. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in high-altitude and polar regions.
